content.description: An ecologist is examining whether the number of fish caught in a large river basin has changed since a fire burned some of the surrounding forested area and vegetation along the river. Data in the form of fishing reports was available for a five-year period before the fire. From a random sample of 195 fishing reports before the fire, the mean catch was 6.3 fish with a standard deviation of 1.6. In a random sample of 143 reports three years after the fire, the mean catch was 7.1 fish with a standard deviation of 2.1.
content.question: Which of the following represents the standard error of the difference in the mean number of fish caught before and after the fire?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 1.6, and denominator 195, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 2.1, and denominator 143, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>195</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>143</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 1.6 squared, and denominator 195, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 2.1 squared, and denominator 143, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>195</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>143</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1.6 squared and denominator the square root of 195, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 2.1 squared, and denominator the square root of 143, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>195</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>143</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 1.6 squared, and denominator 195, end fraction, end root, plus the square root of the fraction with numerator 2.1 squared, and denominator 143, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>195</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>143</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 1.6 squared plus 2.1 squared, and denominator 195 plus 143, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>195</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>143</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 1.6 squared, and denominator 195, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 2.1 squared, and denominator 143, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>195</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>143</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

topic.text: 7.6: Confidence Intervals for the Difference of Two Means

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
